intro: Gerardia lanceolata var. genistifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gerardia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and traditional herbal use.
